title: SB 1.19.9-10 Part 8 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 16-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञान तिमिरान्धस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मैच्ष्री गुरवे नमः
नमाओं विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्निति नामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शून्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्रीवासाधी गौरभक्त वृन्दा

Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Jai Vanarottamam Deviim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet

In this session we continue to discuss from the 9th and 10th verses of the 19th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam. This is part 8 of the discussion. This is the last session in which we will complete the discussion on these two verses.
So we are discussing different sages who appeared there. Srila Prabhupada has given a brief biography of these sages.
So the first chapter of the 19th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
So the next sage, Medha Tithi, an old sage of yore, an assembly member of the heavenly king Indra Deva.
These devatas, they are always guided by great saintly persons.
This is the system. Any ruler, any king, any responsible person in the administration is always guided by learned sages who never occupy,
the post of ruling or controlling or doing administration, but are well-versed in the science.
So they give advice, they instruct, they guide, but they never accept any salary, they never take any remuneration.
They don't expect any material benefit out of that. They are doing it as a seva, as a service.
So this Medha Tithi was an assembly member of the heavenly king Indra Deva.
His son was Kanvamuni, another great sage.
This Kanvamuni brought up Shakuntala in the forest.
And Shakuntala was left behind.
And Shakuntala was left behind by Menaka.
This Medha Tithi was promoted to the heavenly planet by strictly following the principles of retired life or vanaprastha.
Following the Vanashrama Dharma is very, very beneficial for elevation to the higher status in life.
Of course, the ultimate goal of Satcharita.
Such elevation is to come to the point of achieving ultimate liberation by going back to Godhead.
But those who adopt the gradual process of elevation of consciousness,
they have to gradually go from the earth planet to the heavenly planet to the still higher planet, still higher planet, still higher planet.
Bhūloka, Bhūvarloka, Svarloka or Svargaloka.
Bhūloka, Bhūvarloka, Svargaloka or Svargaloka.
Maharloka, Janaloka, Tapoloka, Satyaloka.
This is step-by-step elevation.
But the Bhakti Yoga process is directly go back to Godhead by completely concentrating one's attention on Krishna alone.
This is explained by Krishna in the 8th chapter.
That one who remembers me alone.
That one who remembers me alone at the time of death.
Such a person when he quits the body.
He directly attains shelter at my lotus feet in my personal above.
He is directly transformed to Krishnas personal above.
So, those who don't know about this Bhakti Yoga process.
Or, those who are not having the guidance of the spiritual master or master as the laity.

Master who is expert in Bhakti Yoga, such people have to follow the gradual process of elevation, the other process of Jnana, Karma, Ashtanga Yoga, Hatha Yoga, so many other, Sankhi Yoga, so many other yoga systems are there for the gradual process of elevation.
Next, Devala, a great authority like Narada Muni and Vyasa Deva, his good name is on the list of authorities mentioned in the Bhagavad Gita.
Krishna, sorry, Arjuna, when he acknowledges Krishna's position as a supreme Brahman,
Arjuna is saying that Krishna is accepted as a supreme Brahman, the supreme personality of Godhead, by many great saintly persons who are authorities in Vedic knowledge.
Narada, the foremost authority.
Then,
Asita Devala Vyasa, so Devala's name is mentioned as one of the authorities by Arjuna who all acknowledge Krishna is the supreme personality of Godhead.
This Devala Rishi, he met Maharaja Yudhishthira after the battle of Kurukshetra, and this Devala Rishi was the elder brother of Dhaumya,
the priest of the Pandava family.
Like the Kshatriyas, he also allowed his daughter to select her own husband in a Swayamvara meeting.
And at that ceremony, all the bachelor sons of the rishis were invited.
Next, Gautama, one of the seven great sages of the universe.
In every universe, there is a position of Saptarishis.
They are elevated to that post, they have their own planet in the upper part of the universe, Saptarishi Mandala.
It's called Saptarishi Mandala.
And Gautama Rishi is one of the Saptarishis.
Sharadwaan Gautama was one of his sons.
Now, Srila Prabhupada clarifies one very important point.
Persons in the Gautama gotra today are either his family descendants or in his disciplic succession.
Like those in the Vedic culture, they say, to which gotra do you belong? To which lineage?
Lineage of ancestors.
So, those belonging to Gautama gotra, generally a rishi's name is associated with the gotra.
Gotra means this descendant of a particular sage.
So, two kinds of descendants.
Those who are family descendants are the brahmanas.
Just like Gautama Rishi, he had his sons and his sons had their sons, their sons, their sons, their sons.
Like that in the brahmana lineage, present day brahmanas who are actually Gautama gotra descendants,
they are coming from the Gautama Rishi himself as the descendants.
And those who are Kshatriyas and Vaishyas who claim to be of Gautama gotra,
they generally are having Gautama Rishi as their priest, as their preceptor, as their guide and saintly teacher.
So, two kinds of descendants, those in the disciplic succession who follow Gautama Rishi
and those who are family descendants, seminal descendants and the descendants who are having the spiritual guidance given by Gautama Rishi.
Gautama Rishi was the husband of the famous Ahalya.
Ahalya is a personality who was delivered by Rama or Ramachandra.
So, it is described here that Ahalya turned into a stone when Indradeva, the king of heaven, molested her.
You see, among the devatas, there is always this enviousness
because there is so much material desires for enjoyment.
Sometimes they become envious.
Ahalya was the wife of Gautama Rishi.
But because Indra wanted to enjoy with her, because she is a chaste lady, she will refuse to satisfy Indra.
This is the instruction in the scriptures that another's wife should be respected on the level of one's mother.
So, there is a question of enjoying.
So, similarly, Indradeva, he should not have even approached the wife of Gautama Ahalya even though she might have been very beautiful.
But he nevertheless approached her.
When she refused, he molested her.
He forced her.
So, then she, by her chastity,
she turned into a stone so that Indra could no longer do any more harm to her.
And then she was delivered by Rama.
When Rama touched her, she was delivered.
When Rama was in exile.
Ahalya was delivered by Lord Ramachandra.
Gautama was the grandfather of Kripacharya who was one of the heroes of the battle of Kurukshetra.
Kripacharya was fighting on the side of the Kauravas.
But Kripacharya was the brother-in-law of Dronacharya.
Kripacharya's twin sister married Dronacharya.
So, Dronacharya's wife's brother is Kripacharya.
So, Kripacharya did not die in the battle of Kurukshetra,
even though he was fighting on the side of the Kauravas.
So, later on, Kripacharya actually became the guide for Yudhishthira.
There was no enmity as such.
They would fight on one side or the other side.
There was no enmity actually.
So, Kripacharya agreed to become the,
because he was a very learned sage,
so he became the guide for Yudhishthira
after Yudhishthira was coronated as the emperor of the world after the battle of Kurukshetra.
So, Kripacharya's illustrious lineage is
Kripacharya's grandfather was Gautama Rishi,
the great Gautama Rishi.
Then the last sage being described here is Maitreya Rishi,
a great Rishi of yoga.
He was the spiritual master of Vidura.
In fact, most of the Bhagavatam,
a good portion of the Bhagavatam
is describing the conversation between Vidura and Maitreya,
which is cited by Shukadeva Goswami.
When Shukadeva Goswami was speaking the Bhagavatam to Pariksit Maharaj,
to answer some of Pariksit's questions,
Shukadeva Goswami would cite a similar question was asked by someone else in the past.
This is called parampara system.
Nobody has to manufacture any answer for any question.
The entire body of spiritual knowledge is descending from Krishna.
Krishna first instructed Brahma, Brahma instructed Narada, Narada instructed Vyasa, Vyasa instructed Deja.
Shukadeva Goswami and other personalities.
So Vidura inquired from Maitreya Rishi when on pilgrimage.
He met Maitreya Rishi in Badrikashram.
And he inquired from Maitreya Rishi.
Of course, Vidura himself is enlightened and learned,
pure devotee, Mahabhagavata.
He is one of the Mahajanas.
But in order to teach us how we have to make inquiries from the right authority,
from the right source, we have to acquire this knowledge of the Self, Brahmavidya.
You cannot study Brahmavidya or become knowledgeable in the Brahmavidya simply by studying books,
simply by doing some meditation and all that.
You have to hear from a Self-realized soul.
That is the only way and there is no other way.
There is no substitute for that.
So Vidura heard from Maitreya who was Self-realized.
And that conversation is elaborately described in the later cantos of the Bhagavad Gita.
So Maitreya Rishi is famous.
As the one who instructed Vidura in this spiritual subject matter, Brahmavidya.
Maitreya advised Dhritarashtra to keep good relations with the Pandavas.
And Dhritarashtra was plotting and planning to kill the Pandavas.
Actually, Dhritarashtra was not planning to kill the Pandavas.
It was Duryodhana who wanted to kill the Pandavas.
So Dhritarashtra, instead of stopping his sons from attempting to kill the Pandavas, he supported his sons.
That is when the others intervened.
Like Maitreya Rishi, he advised Dhritarashtra not to ill-treat the Pandavas because Dhritarashtra was a caretaker.
So not to ill-treat his brother's sons, his nephews, but rather to keep good relations.
Duryodhana disagreed and thus Maitreya Rishi cursed Duryodhana.
Maitreya also met Vyasadeva and had religious discourses with Vyasadeva.
So that is the end of this purport and we stop here.
Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
